articles.description: Novak Djokovic draws level with Australian Margaret Court on 24 major singles titles by outlasting Daniil Medvedev in a punishing US Open final.
articles.title: Djokovic wins record-equalling 24th Grand Slam title

articles.description: Wales survive a dramatic late Fiji fightback to edge a captivating World Cup opener in Bordeaux.
articles.title: Wales survive late Fiji fightback to win opener

articles.description: Luis Rubiales resigns as president of the Spanish Football Federation after widespread criticism for kissing forward Jenni Hermoso at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Spanish FA president Rubiales resigns over Hermoso kiss

articles.description: Scotland rugby fans dreamed of what-might-be against South Africa, but this was a dose of reality served cold, writes Tom English.
articles.title: 'Russell and Scotland get lost in South African maze'

articles.description: England batter Liam Livingstone reflects on his match-winning 95 not out against New Zealand.
articles.title: 'I'm a better player than someone who just slogs it'

articles.description: England have sent a reminder to the World Cup's big guns with their performance against Argentina, says Matt Dawson.
articles.title: 'Ford had freedom to take control in Farrell absence'

articles.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill admits their miserable Euro 2024 qualifying campaign has started to feel like Groundhog Day.
articles.title: Process is painful but we must persevere - O'Neill

articles.description: Watch highlights as England comfortably beat New Zealand by 79 runs to level the one-day international series in a rain-affected encounter at Southampton.
articles.title: Livingstone helps England beat NZ to level ODI series

articles.description: Sweden's Vincent Norrman shoots a closing 65 to win the Irish Open as Rory McIlroy blows his chances by finding water four times.
articles.title: Norrman wins Irish Open as McIlroy hopes are sunk

articles.description: Promoter Eddie Hearn says terms have been agreed for Anthony Joshua to fight Deontay Wilder, but the Briton may walk away if contracts are not agreed soon.
articles.title: Terms agreed for Joshua v Wilder, says Hearn
